oct.octree

Class OctOctree

  • java.lang.Object
    • oct.octree.OctOctree

  • public class OctOctree
extends Object
    This is the main class of the library. Here are included all the methods that operates on the structure of the octree. To start a project, you'll need to define an OctOctree, with its dimensions in XYZ coordinates. The information about the individual nodes is stored in a HashSet named 'nodeList' that can be accessed directly. Other fields such as the minimum and maximum depth of the tree are private and need to be accessed by a function. Minimum and maximum levels are there to limit the computing time of various functions.

      • setDimensions

        public void setDimensions(OctXYZ _dimension)
        This resizes the octree. It is a scaling of the whole existing structure.

      • setMinDepth

        public void setMinDepth(int _minD)
        Changes the minimum depth of the octree. It might be necessary to clean the octree afterwards if you use this command with nodes already in the tree. If you increase the minimum level, some of the existing nodes might be too large. Use algCleanLevels() to remove those.

      • setMaxDepth

        public void setMaxDepth(int _maxD)
        Changes the maximum depth of the octree. It might be necessary to clean the octree afterwards if you use this command with nodes already in the tree. If you decrease the maximum level, some of the existing nodes might be too small and create errors. Use algCleanLevels() to remove those.

        public OctXYZ getDimension()

        public HashSet<OctNode> getNodes()

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Clears the octree. Sets minD @ 0 and maxD @ 8, origin and dimension to (0,0,0).

      • clearNodes

        public void clearNodes()
        Clears only the list of nodes.

      • addPoint

        public void addPoint(OctXYZ _tempPoint,
                     int _level)
        Adds the node that contains the point at the specified level.

      • addNode

        public void addNode(OctNode _tempNode)
        Adds a node. If the node is already in the octree, does nothing. Accepts node that are out of bounds or have a level outside the min/max depth.

      • deleteNode

        public void deleteNode(OctNode _tempNode)
        Removes a node. If the node is not in the octree, does nothing.

      • addNodeVerbose

        public void addNodeVerbose(OctNode _tempNode)
        Adds a node. If the node is already in the octree, prints error.

      • deleteNodeVerbose

        public void deleteNodeVerbose(OctNode _tempNode)
        Removes a node. If the node is not in the octree, prints error.

        Adds a list of nodes.

        Adds a set of nodes.

      • deleteNode

        public void deleteNode(HashSet<OctNode> _tempNodeList)
        Removes a set of nodes.

      • boolSub

        public void boolSub(OctNode subNode)
        Boolean subtracts one node from the octree. Requires the min and max depth level to the octree to be set correctly.

      • boolAdd

        public void boolAdd(OctNode addNode)
        Boolean adds one node from the octree. Requires the min and max depth level to the octree to be set correctly.

      • filterNode

        public OctNode filterNode(OctNode _tempNode)
        Will return a node if there is a node in the octree with the same code and level as the _tempNode. Else returns null.

      • filterNode

        public ArrayList<OctNode> filterNode(ArrayList<OctNode> _tempNodeList)
        Filters a list of node to keep only the nodes in the octree.

      • filterNode

        public HashSet<OctNode> filterNode(HashSet<OctNode> _tempNodeList)
        Filters a set of node to keep only the nodes in the octree.

      • subdivideNode

        public void subdivideNode(OctNode _tempNode)
        Subdivides a node by replacing it by its 8 children. Don't use it in a loop, use nodeSubdivide(ArrayList) or nodeSubdivide(HashSet).

      • subdivideNode

        public void subdivideNode(ArrayList<OctNode> _tempList)
        Subdivides a list of nodes by replacing it by their 8 children.

      • subdivideNode

        public void subdivideNode(HashSet<OctNode> _tempNodeList)
        Subdivides a list of nodes by replacing it by their 8 children.

      • mergeNode

        public void mergeNode(OctNode _tempNode)
        Replaces a node by its parent. Removes the siblings that are also in the parent, but not smaller nodes! Can create nested nodes!

      • mergeNode

        public void mergeNode(ArrayList<OctNode> _tempList)
        Replaces list of nodes by their parent. Removes the siblings that are also in the parent, but not smaller nodes! Can create nested nodes!

      • mergeNode

        public void mergeNode(HashSet<OctNode> _tempList)
        Replaces list of nodes by their parent. Removes the siblings that are also in the parent, but not smaller nodes! Can create nested nodes!

      • algFixDepth

        public void algFixDepth()
        Automatically set the minimum and maximum depth of the octree according to its content. Can be run before other algorithms to ensure maximum efficiency or a consistent result.

      • algGenerate

        public void algGenerate(int _depth)
        Generates all possible nodes at the specified level and add them to the tree. Requires the min and max depth level to the octree to be set correctly.

      • algGenerateByCenter

        public void algGenerateByCenter(OctFunction _f,
                                float _threshold,
                                int _depth,
                                boolean _smaller,
                                boolean _equal,
                                boolean _larger)
        Generates all nodes where the center has a value smaller/equal/larger to the threshold. Requires the min and max depth level to the octree to be set correctly.

      • algGenerateByCorners

        public void algGenerateByCorners(OctFunction _f,
                                 float _threshold,
                                 int _start,
                                 int _end,
                                 boolean _below,
                                 boolean _equal,
                                 boolean _above)
        Generates all nodes that are below/crossing/above the threshold by looking at the 8 corners. Requires the min and max depth level to the octree to be set correctly. Use the same start and end to avoid recursion.

      • algSimplify

        public void algSimplify(int _mindepth)
        Simplifies the octree by maximizing the size of the nodes, grouping nodes in bigger nodes. Requires the min and max depth level to the octree to be set correctly.
        Parameters:
        _mindepth - minimum node size to keep, even if the 8 octants are full

      • algConstrain

        public void algConstrain(int _constraint)
        Ensures that one node has no neighbor smaller that a certain size by subdividing nodes. Requires the min and max depth level to the octree to be set correctly.
        Parameters:
        _constraint - maxmimum level difference between two adjacent nodes

      • algCleanNested

        public void algCleanNested()
        Ensures that no node is nested in another node. Requires the min and max depth level to the octree to be set correctly.

      • algCleanOutOfBounds

        public void algCleanOutOfBounds()
        Ensures that no node is outside of the bounds of the octree. Requires the min and max depth level to the octree to be set correctly.

      • algCleanWrongLevels

        public void algCleanWrongLevels()
        Ensures that no node is outside of the bounds of the octree. Requires the min and max depth level to the octree to be set correctly.

      • drawAsCenters

        public void drawAsCenters()

      • drawAsVertices

        public void drawAsVertices()

      • drawAsEdges

        public void drawAsEdges()

      • drawAsFaces

        public void drawAsFaces()

      • drawAsFaceSkeleton

        public void drawAsFaceSkeleton()
        Requires the min and max depth level to the octree to be set correctly. Does not work with nested nodes.

      • drawAsEdgeSkeleton

        public void drawAsEdgeSkeleton()
        Requires the min and max depth level to the octree to be set correctly. Does not work with nested nodes.

      • drawBoundingBox

        public void drawBoundingBox()

      • drawOrigin

        public void drawOrigin()
